title: What does HTML stand for?
answer:
HTML stands for HyperText Markup Language.

To break this down:

* HyperText refers to text that contains links to other texts, allowing users to easily navigate between connected documents.

* Markup indicates that HTML is used to annotate text with codes that define how the text should be structured and presented.

* Language signifies that HTML has its own syntax and rules for writing these markup instructions.

HTML is the standard markup language for creating web pages. It describes the structure and content of a web page, which web browsers then interpret to display the page to users.

title: What is the purpose of the <!DOCTYPE html> declaration?
answer:
The purpose of the <!DOCTYPE html> declaration is:

* To specify that the document is an HTML5 document

* To help browsers render the page correctly by indicating which version of HTML the page is using

* To ensure consistent rendering across different browsers

* To enable proper validation of the HTML document

* To trigger standards mode in browsers, rather than quirks mode

This declaration should be the very first line in an HTML document, before the <html> tag.

title: What are HTML tags?
answer: They are the building blocks of HTML, used to create elements

title: What is an HTML element?
answer: An element is a part of an HTML document defined by a start tag, content, and an end tag

title: What is an HTML attribute?
answer: Attributes provide additional information about HTML elements

title: What is the difference between <div> and <span>?
answer: <div> is a block-level element, while <span> is an inline element

title: What is the purpose of the <head> tag?
answer: The <head> tag contains meta-information about the document, such as title, links to stylesheets, and meta tags

title: What is the purpose of the <body> tag?
answer: The <body> tag contains the content of the HTML document

title: What is a semantic element in HTML?
answer: A semantic element clearly describes its meaning in a human- and machine-readable way, like <article>, <footer>, and <section>

title: What is the difference between <strong> and <b>?
answer: <strong> indicates that the enclosed text is of strong importance, while <b> simply makes the text bold without implying importance

title: What is the difference between <em> and <i>?
answer: <em> indicates emphasized text with stress, while <i> just italicizes the text

title: What is the <a> tag used for?
answer: The <a> tag is used to create hyperlinks

title: What is the purpose of the tag?
answer: The tag is used to embed images in an HTML document

title: What does the alt attribute in the tag specify?
answer: The alt attribute provides alternative text for an image if it cannot be displayed

title: What is the purpose of the <ul> and <ol> tags?
answer: <ul> is used for unordered lists, and <ol> is used for ordered lists

title: What is the <table> tag used for?
answer: The <table> tag is used to create tables in HTML

title: What is the purpose of the <form> tag?
answer: The <form> tag is used to create a form for user input

title: What are the common attributes of the <form> tag?
answer: Common attributes include action, method, and enctype

title: What is the purpose of the <input> tag?
answer: The <input> tag is used to create input fields in a form

title: What are the different types of <input> fields?
answer: Common types include text, password, submit, reset, radio, checkbox, button, file, hidden, image, date, and email

title: What is the purpose of the <textarea> tag?
answer: The <textarea> tag is used to create a multi-line text input field

title: What is the purpose of the <button> tag?
answer: The <button> tag is used to create clickable buttons

title: What is the <select> tag used for?
answer: The <select> tag is used to create a drop-down list

title: What is the <option> tag used for?
answer: The <option> tag defines an option in a drop-down list

title: What is the <link> tag used for?
answer: The <link> tag is used to link external resources like stylesheets

title: What is the <meta> tag used for?
answer: The <meta> tag provides metadata about the HTML document, such as author, description, and keywords

title: What is the <title> tag used for?
answer: The <title> tag sets the title of the HTML document, shown in the browser's title bar or tab

title: What is the <style> tag used for?
answer: The <style> tag is used to define internal CSS

title: What is the <script> tag used for?
answer: The <script> tag is used to embed or reference JavaScript code

title: What is the purpose of the <header> tag?
answer: The <header> tag represents the header of a section or page, typically containing headings, logos, and navigation

title: What is the purpose of the <footer> tag?
answer: The <footer> tag represents the footer of a section or page, typically containing author information, copyright, and links

title: What is the <main> tag used for?
answer: The <main> tag specifies the main content of a document

title: What is the <section> tag used for?
answer: The <section> tag defines sections in a document, such as chapters, headers, footers, or any other sections

title: What is the <article> tag used for?
answer: The <article> tag represents a self-contained composition in a document, like a blog post or news article

title: What is the <aside> tag used for?
answer: The <aside> tag represents content that is tangentially related to the content around it, like sidebars or call-out boxes

title: What is the <nav> tag used for?
answer: The <nav> tag defines a set of navigation links

title: What is the <figure> tag used for?
answer: The <figure> tag specifies self-contained content, like illustrations, diagrams, or photos

title: What is the <figcaption> tag used for?
answer: The <figcaption> tag defines a caption for a <figure> element

title: What is the <time> tag used for?
answer: The <time> tag represents a specific period in time

title: What is the purpose of the <mark> tag?
answer: The <mark> tag highlights or marks text for reference or notation

title: What is the <progress> tag used for?
answer: The <progress> tag represents the completion progress of a task

title: What is the <meter> tag used for?
answer: The <meter> tag represents a scalar measurement within a known range, like disk usage or temperature

title: What is the <details> tag used for?
answer: The <details> tag specifies additional details that the user can view or hide

title: What is the <summary> tag used for?
answer: The <summary> tag defines a visible heading for a <details> element

title: What is the purpose of the <template> tag?
answer: The <template> tag holds client-side content that should not be displayed when the page loads but can be displayed later using JavaScript

title: What is the <blockquote> tag used for?
answer: The <blockquote> tag is used to define a section that is quoted from another source

title: What is the <code> tag used for?
answer: The <code> tag defines a piece of computer code

title: What is the <pre> tag used for?
answer: The <pre> tag defines preformatted text, preserving whitespace and line breaks

title: What is the <abbr> tag used for?
answer: The <abbr> tag defines an abbreviation or acronym
